page.title: 09HISTORICAL NOTES
page.content:
There is a Roman road. It is about six foot under the road from Amport to Grateley. It is made from pebbles, flint, stone and sand. There is an old hedge which is 1350 years old. The way we worked it out was to multiply the number of species of tree or shrub found in the hedge by 110 years and added 30 years.
i.e. (number of species x 110 yrs) + 30 yrs = Age of hedge.
12 species, at least, were identified. It is about 1 mile south east of Amport. At Gollard farm near Grateley there is said to be a Roman gold hoard but none has ever been found. There is a site of a Roman villa 3 or 4 miles south of Monxton.
